p: Microemulsions (mean droplet size 100â€“400 nm [ 152]) and nanoemulsions (1 to 100 nm [ 153]) are isotropic dispersions of two non-miscible liquids (oil and water). The former is thermodynamically stable system in which the inner phase can figure as spheroid, cylinder-like, plane-like, or as a bicontinuous structure [ 154], whereas the latter is thermodynamically unstable, usually requiring a co-surfactant because its free energy is higher than the free energy of the separate oil and water [ 155].
